attributes.action: Do not require schools to inform parents of a child's gender identity.
attributes.additional_details:
Informing parents of a child's gender identity, without the child's consent is a breach in the privacy and safety of the child. Many children that are questioning their gender identity may not feel safe to do so at home or to inform their parents. 

The government has an absolute obligation to protect all children from discrimination, abuse and harassment.
attributes.background: Do not require schools or teachers to inform parents of a child's sexuality or gender identity. Furthermore, do not require parent consent or permission to use a child's preferred pronouns.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petition which call for similar actions: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/636802
Do not require schools to tell parents their child is transgender/non-binary

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/639904
Do not issue guidance making it unsafe for school students to question gender
